result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Lamont Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Lamont Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

RUMS OF NOTICE OF CERTIFICATION - UNDELIVERABLE AND UNABLE TO FORWARD PER USPS - ja

Defendant Jerome Lamont Taylor in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. D.A. 946.41(1) plea; joint rec 60 days jail forthwith jail credit ( CREDIT FOR 45 DAYS. Time served; $243.00. Atty Gumz agrees.   Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty. DEFENDANT APOLOGIZED. COURT:SENTENCED TO 60 DAYS JAIL WITH 45 DAYS CREDIT- TIME SERVED. $243.00 COSTS. COURT ADVISED $15 PAYMENT PLAN FEE. $50 PER MONTH TO COMMENCE 7/1/15

Defendant Jerome Lamont Taylor in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Jerome Lamont Taylor in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jerome Lamont Taylor in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz appearing by telephone.  Defendant Jerome Lamont Taylor in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court has not received that copy and states that will just be a bond hearing.
Atty Hendee states factual basis.  
Court finds probable cause.

Atty Hendee requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Hendee states that there is an open matter in Sauk County and an active warrant from the State of Ohio.  Atty Gumz responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 cash bond; no special conditions requested.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
